page.title: 07HOW GORDON HAS CHANGED.
page.content: 1861 The town was just one long street.It had a railway station.The popultion was around 931.180 pupils attended school=4 classes of about 45 pupils. Two thirds of the houses had two or less windows.There were many trades eg fishing tackle maker,tailor, milliner,tea dealer etc. 1985 Today Gordon is one long street with two new housing estates.All the houses have plenty of windows.the population is about 600.Compared to 100 years ago housing conditions are very good.There is no railway but it doesn't matter because lots of people have cars,bikes etc.Families today are smaller so there are only fifty pupils at the school.The new school was built ten years ago.Nowadays there are only four shops.This is because people go to town for a better choice.
